meanings.definition: The quality of being easily shaped or worked with a machine.
meanings.sent1: The machinability of this metal allows for precise cutting.
meanings.sent2: The machinability of wood makes it a popular choice for crafting.
meanings.sent3: The machinability of the clay made it a breeze to sculpt a tiny elephant.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had a machinability that effortlessly transformed ideas into reality.
meanings.sent5: The machinability of the fabric was so high that sewing intricate patterns was a joy.

meanings.definition: The ease with which a material can be cut or shaped by a machine.
meanings.sent1: The machinability of plastic simplifies the manufacturing process.
meanings.sent2: Engineers consider machinability when selecting materials for production.
meanings.sent3: The machinability of the dough made it simple to create perfectly shaped cookies.
meanings.sent4: His words had a machinability that cut through the confusion like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The machinability of the metal was so smooth that the machine glided through it effortlessly.
